skills.text: THE BEST WAY TO SHARPEN YOUR SKILLS IS TO USE THEM

state.title: Degree
state.text: BTech (Honors) in Information and Communication Technology with minor Comutational Science

about.aboutMe: I'm a curious, passionate and dedicated grad, all set to graduate in 2022. Loves Programming and Machine Learning. Enriched by exploring industrial working experience as well as research. Powerful fundamentals of Computational Science and practical implementation. Aspires to use skills and knowledge to make a difference in the real world. Looks forward to connecting! :)

projects.text: A PROJECT IS COMPLETE WHEN IT STARTS WORKING FOR YOU, RATHER THAN YOU WORKING FOR IT

project.heading: Finance/Deep Learning
project.title: Predicting cryptocurrency prices using Recurrent Neural Networks
project.text: Used data of past few years to build a model using Recurrent Neural Network (LSTM) to predict the Bitcoin prices on a particular day. Achieved a precision score of 0.67.

project.heading: Quantum Computing
project.title: Monte Carlo Pricing of Financial Derivatives
project.text: Constructed and simulated quatum monte carlo model for option pricing using quantum algorithm and circuit.

project.heading: Deep Learning
project.title: Image to image translation using Generative Adversarial Networks
project.text: Performed detailed analysis of shortcomings in the current single domain to domain image translation models via literature review. Reproduced the results of the paper “StarGAN: Unified Generative Adversarial Networks for Multi-Domain Image-to-Image Translation” which implements StarGAN and compared all the models to identify the superior one.

contact.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.

resume.text: EXPERIENCE IS NOT WHAT HAPPENS TO YOU, IT'S WHAT YOU DO WITH WHAT HAPPENS TO YOU

education.title: ORIE Masters of Engineering (Financial Engineering)
education.heading: Cornell University, Ithaca, New York
education.text: Stochastic Calculus, Statistics of Financial Engineering, Optimisation, Statistical Data Mining applied Time Series

education.title: BTech in Information and Communication Technology with minor in Computational Science
education.heading: Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology
education.text: Computational Finance, Machine Learning, Deep learning, Calculus, Probability, Statistics and Information Theory, Group theory and Linear Algebra, Optimisation, Computational and numerical methods, High Performance Computing, Modelling and Simulation, Quantum Computing, Introductory Computational Physics, Design and Analysis of Algorithm, Principles of Economics, Technology and Economic, Organisation Behaviour

exp.title: Product Engineer Intern

data.heading: Spriklr, Gurgaon, India
data.text: Build a docker containing deep learning model for emotion identification. Trained the model using labelled data generated using GPU via zero shot classification model pretrained over MNLI dataset. Performed testing of different sentiment predictions models based on model metadata shifted to tensorflow servable platform to compare with performance of original models.

heading: Spriklr, Gurgaon, India
text: Worked on Multilingual Toxic Comment Classification. Implemented a range of approaches from baseline classifiers to sophisticated models like Cross Language Modelling RoBERTa (XLM-R) and ensemble models. Further extend the work to a fully functional Document Classifier.

data.heading: Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad
data.text: Built a web app using shiny package in R language for Option Pricing using Black Scholes model, Greeks/Advanced Greeks pricing for a portfolio of options.

data.heading: Spriklr, Gurgaon, India
data.text: Worked on Multilingual Toxic Comment Classification. Implemented a range of approaches from baseline classifiers to sophisticated models like Cross Language Modelling RoBERTa (XLM-R) and ensemble models. Further extend the work to a fully functional Document Classifier.

exp.title: Dhirubhai Ambani Institude of Information and Communication Technology

data.heading: Linear Algebra Teaching Assistant
data.text: Conduct weekly tutorials. Assist the professor in structuring the course and evaluating student performance.

data.heading: Undergraduate Researcher (in collaboration with Institute for Plasma Research)
data.text: Devised a novel approach for synthetic time series data generation for tokamak plasma disruption. Built a model for identifying pre-disruptive current that acts as a precursor for predicting disruption. Presented the work at International Conference Of Plasma Sciences 2020 and published a paper "An Application of Machine Learning for Plasma Current Quench Studies via Synthetic Data Generation"in Fusion Engineering and Design.

data.heading: Member of Programming Club
data.text: Associated with of the programming club at DA-IICT for about 2 years now. Responsibilities included conducting regular sessions for teaching new topics to students and creating/managing coding contests for entire student community.

awards.text: COMFORT IS THE ENEMY OF ACHIEVEMENT
awards.firstChild: Rank 1 in State Board examinations in all 4 semesters of grade 11-12 (out of a total of above 70,000 students)

achv.name: Recipient of Dhirubhai Ambani Scholarship by Reliance Foundation.
Among the top 1% students who were offered scholarship of 0.8 lakhs under the INSPIRE initiative for pursuing pure science.
Recipient of Certificate of Appreciation from University Dean for best summer internship presentation (Multilingual Toxic Comment Classification - Sprinklr).
